      <T extends Message<T>>
      T      		 set(T message)
      Configures the OutputBody representation of message to write the RDF value to the accepted output stream and sets the Content-Type header to the MIME type of the RDF serialization selected according to the Accept header of the request associated to the message, if one is present, or to "text/turtle", otherwise.

    • Method Detail

      • rdf

        public static RDFBody rdf()
        Retrieves the RDF body format.
        Returns:
        the singleton RDF body format instance

      • get

        public Result<Collection<Statement>,Failure> get(Message<?> message)
        Description copied from interface: Body
        Retrieves a structured body from a message.

        Processing failure should be reported using the following HTTP status codes:

        • Response.UnsupportedMediaType for missing bodies;
        • Response.BadRequest for malformed bodies, unless a more specific status code is available.

        The default implementation returns a failure reporting the Response.UnsupportedMediaType status, unless explicitly overridden.

        Specified by:
        get in interface Body<Collection<Statement>>
        Parameters:
        message - the message the structured body managed by this body format is to be retrieved from
        Returns:
        the optional RDF body representation of message, as retrieved from its InputBody representation, if present; a failure reporting RDF processing errors with the Response.BadRequest status, otherwise

      • set

        public <T extends Message<T>> T set(T message)
        Configures the OutputBody representation of message to write the RDF value to the accepted output stream and sets the Content-Type header to the MIME type of the RDF serialization selected according to the Accept header of the request associated to the message, if one is present, or to "text/turtle", otherwise.
        Specified by:
        set in interface Body<Collection<Statement>>
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of message
        Parameters:
        message - the message to be configured to hold a structured body managed by this body format
        Returns:
        the configured message
